items.title: Sterling Hospitals appoints Santosh Marathe as CEO & MD
items.summary: Sterling Hospitals has appointed Santosh Marathe as its new Managing Director and CEO to lead its next phase of expansion and operational improvements. With over two decades of experience, Marathe is expected to streamline hospital networks and enhance organizational efficiency. Sterling Hospitals, a leading Gujarat-based group, operates six NABH-accredited facilities across the region.

items.title: Lost share certificates? Sebi plans simpler, cheaper route for investors to get duplicate copies
items.summary: Sebi has proposed easing the process for investors to obtain duplicate physical share certificates by doubling the simplified-documentation limit to ₹10 lakh and allowing a single Affidavit-cum-Indemnity. The regulator also plans standardised forms, company-issued newspaper notices for higher-value cases, and mandatory demat issuance to streamline legacy physical holdings.

items.title: Russia sets yield guidance for 3.2-year yuan-denominated OFZ bonds at 6.25%-6.50%, source says
items.summary: The yield guidance for its 7.5-year yuan-denominated OFZ government bonds has been set at no higher than 7.5%, the source said

items.title: Tesla opens first full-scale experience centre in India
items.summary: Tesla has launched its first full-scale retail centre in Gurugram, India. This move signifies a more structured approach to sales and customer support for its imported electric vehicles. Tesla entered the Indian market this year, offering two Model Y variants.

items.title: Adani Ports’ upside surprise hinges on meeting its ambitious port volume target
items.summary: Adani essentially remains a bet on domestic ports and the ability to expand rapidly.&nbsp;

items.title: Labour reforms: How to convince workers that today’s pay cheque matters less than tomorrow’s security
items.summary: India's labour codes offer a path to a secure workforce, but their new definition of ‘wages’ could mean lower takehome pay in lieu of larger retiral benefits. Employees may grumble, but empathetic messaging could get them around.

items.title: State Bank of India's key margin target safe even if RBI trims repo rate by 0.25%: Chairman C S Setty
items.summary: State Bank of India Chairman C S Setty believes the bank will meet its net interest margin target of 3 percent. He anticipates a potential 0.25 percent repo rate cut by the Reserve Bank of India next week. Setty highlighted several strategies SBI will employ to protect its margins.

items.title: Vietnam raises $229 mln in government bond auction
items.summary: The uptake was also lower, with 43% of the bonds on offer sold, compared with 66% last week, according to a Hanoi Stock Exchange filing.

items.title: Nifty can hit 29,000 level in 12 months, says PL Capital; adds these 3 stocks to model portfolio
items.summary: The Nifty 50 outlook from PL Capital is optimistic, predicting a rise to 29,000 due to better corporate earnings and improving domestic conditions. The firm emphasizes a shift in earnings revisions and has adjusted its portfolio to focus on high-conviction sectors.

items.title: McKinsey cuts about 200 tech jobs, shifts more roles to AI
items.summary: McKinsey & Co. has eliminated approximately 200 global tech jobs, signaling a broader trend of consulting firms leveraging AI for automation. The company is assessing tasks for AI integration and may implement further reductions in non-client-facing roles over the next two years.

items.title: Nykaa shares hit 3.5-yr high after stellar 76% rally from March 2025 lows. Still time to join the rally?
items.summary: Nykaa shares have surged nearly 76% from their March 2025 low and are now trading close to a 52-week high, reaching their strongest levels in over three years. The rally has lifted its market cap to about ₹77,200 crore.

items.title: Turkey's real estate firm Ronesans' shares fall 7% after Singaporean GIC sells part of stake
items.summary: According to a filing by Ronesans Gayrimenkul Yatirim on the Turkish stock exchange platform, 15 million shares were sold at a price of 140 lira per share. Upon completion of the transaction GIC's stake will decline to 13.85% from 18.38%.

items.title: Lord’s Mark Industries acquires 85% stake in Renalyx to scale indigenous dialysis technology
items.summary: Lord's Mark Industries has acquired an 85% stake in Renalyx Health Systems, a Bengaluru-based med-tech firm known for its AI-powered smart hemodialysis machine. This strategic move aims to bolster Lord's Mark's presence in advanced medical technologies, particularly for chronic kidney disease. Renalyx will spearhead R&D for kidney and liver devices, enhancing renal care accessibility across India.

items.title: Japan's Nikkei surges after Wall Street's gains, tech leads charge
items.summary: Wall Street extended its rally on Tuesday as a spate of economic data appeared to support the case for the U.S. Federal Reserve to implement its third and final rate cut of the year in December, while softness in the tech sector limited the Nasdaq's gains.

items.title: K K Silk Mills IPO day 1: GMP, subscription status, price band, other details of BSE SME IPO
items.summary: The K K Silk Mills IPO opened on Wednesday, November 26, with a price band of  ₹36 to  ₹38 per equity share. The latest GMP of K K Silk Mills indicated the SME stock could be listed at a premium.

items.title: European shares jump on Ukraine peace prospects, US rate cut hopes
items.summary: The pan-European STOXX 600 closed up 0.91% at 568.01. Major regional bourses also ended higher, with Germany's DAX and France's CAC up 1% and 0.8%, respectively.

items.title: IL&FS group clears  ₹48,463 crore debt, achieves nearly 80% of target
items.summary: IL&amp;FS group repays  ₹48,463 cr to its lenders, reaches nearly 80% of target.&nbsp;

items.title: Tesla Model Y to help customers recover ₹20 lakh in India
items.summary: In India, the Tesla Model Y confronts high import duties that inflate its price, but the company is emphasizing the long-term savings that come from reduced fuel and maintenance costs. While the global shift towards green technology is gaining momentum, electric vehicles still represent a small segment of the automotive market.

items.title: Pace Digitek share price jumps 3% after arm secures  ₹200 crore order from L&T
items.summary: Pace Digitek share price rose 3% after announcing a  ₹200 crore order from Larsen &amp; Toubro for Battery Energy Storage Systems. This follows another order of  ₹929 crore from Maharashtra State Power Generation.

items.title: Excelsoft Technologies share price falls over 5% after strong listing. Should you buy, sell or hold the stock?
items.summary: Excelsoft Technologies IPO listing today was better than the Street estimates. Ahead of the share debut, Excelsoft Technologies IPO GMP today signaled a listing premium of more than 4%.

items.title: Domestic demand revival triggers earnings upgrades; Nifty set to approach 29,000: PL Capital
items.summary: After five consecutive quarters of downward revisions, Nifty earnings estimates have finally turned positive.

items.summary: Market breadth remains firmly positive with 2,728 stocks advancing against 1,229 declines on the BSE, where 4,144 stocks were traded

items.title: Indrajaal unveils anti-drone patrol vehicle
items.summary: The Indrajaal Ranger is an AI-enabled counter-drone system designed to respond to drone-led threats

items.title: SMS Pharmaceuticals shares soar 17% after USFDA approves reformulated Ranitidine tablets
items.summary: SMS Pharmaceuticals shares rose nearly 17% after USFDA approved reformulated Ranitidine tablets from VKT Pharma. The approval, following safety assessments, marks the return of a key acid-reducing medication to the US market, enhancing patient access to vital treatments.

items.title: Vodafone Idea share price zooms 50% in 3 months: Is the tide finally turning for the telecom stock?
items.summary: Vodafone Idea share price rally has been supported by a series of positive developments, with the foremost being the government's efforts to ensure the survival of Vodafone Idea.

items.title: MCX shares surge past ₹10,000 mark for first time, up 3.27% in intraday trade
items.summary: The commodity exchange platform has now gained in eight of the last 10 trading sessions and is up 10 per cent in November alone, marking its third straight month of gains

items.title: Productivity focus can help India unleash new White Revolution
items.summary: National Milk Day is a reminder of how far the country has come, but it must also be a catalyst for where it goes next.

items.title: Tata Sierra launch: Street bets on volume boost, SUV market share gain for Tata Motors PV; stock rallies
items.summary: Tata Sierra launch expected to lift Tata’s SUV market share from 16.9% to 20% - 25%. Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles targets double-digit growth in FY26, backed by strong post-GST demand momentum, and plans to extend Sierra lineup with EV/AWD variants.

items.title: PSU Dividend Stock: PFC share price in focus as it turns ex-dividend today. Do you own?
items.summary: Power Finance Corporation's shares are in focus as November 26 marks the record date for a second interim dividend of  ₹3.65 per share. The dividend will be paid by December 6, 2025, and only shareholders by November 26 are eligible.

items.title: Cabinet likely to give nod to Rs 7,000 cr rare earths scheme: Report
items.summary: The Union Cabinet is poised to approve a Rs 7,000 crore incentive scheme for rare earth permanent magnets, aiming to secure critical materials for EVs, renewables, and defense. This move comes as China, a dominant supplier, tightens export controls, prompting India to accelerate its domestic supply chain development.

items.title: Airtel shares drop 1.5% as Mittal family offloads 0.56% stake for ₹7,193 crore
items.summary: The shares are being offered at a floor price of ₹2,096.70 per share, representing a 3 per cent discount to Tuesday’s closing price.

items.title: Nuvama Research initiates Buy on Premier Energies shares with a target of Rs 1,270
items.summary: Nuvama Research has initiated coverage on Premier Energies with a “BUY” rating, citing strong growth prospects in India’s expanding New Energy ecosystem. Backward integration, rising capacities, supportive policies, and robust cash flows position the company for sustained expansion. Despite medium-term margin pressures, Premier remains well placed to benefit from sectoral tailwinds and emerging technologies.

items.title: McNuggetization in the People’s Republic: Chinese diets are changing and it's helping the climate cause
items.summary: As Chinese consumers downshift from high-emission sources of nutrition to cheaper everyday protein, the country is inadvertently helping the planet. Given China’s population, a modest adjustment could mean a lot.

items.title: IL&FS repays ₹48,463 crore, achieves nearly 80% of its debt resolution target
items.summary: Debt-laden IL&FS has repaid ₹48,463 crore to lenders as of September 2025, nearing its ₹61,000-crore debt resolution target. This marks a significant increase from March 2025, with asset monetization and interim distributions driving the progress. The group is close to resolving nearly four-fifths of its intended debt.

items.title: The South is eating OTT’s lunch — Bollywood isn’t the main course anymore
items.summary: India's streaming economy has shifted south, with southern states now driving growth and creative bets. Once Bollywood-centric, platforms are investing heavily in Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam, and Kannada content, attracting millions of viewers and reshaping the national entertainment landscape.

items.title: Global news wrap: Rate cut expectations, US data fog, AI bubble warning
items.summary: Major central banks are expected to end 2025 with rate cuts amid trade-related uncertainties, and weak growth impulses&nbsp;.US' delayed data release due to the 43-day-long government shutdown has created an information gap for investors and policymakers&nbsp;

items.title: Man Infraconstruction shares rise as promoter Parag K Shah raises stake in realty stock
items.summary: The small-cap realty stock has been underperforming in the near-term as it has declined by over 15% in a month and 25% in the last six months.

items.title: Safran to triple its India ops revenue to over €3 billion by 2030
items.summary: French aerospace giant Safran is set to significantly boost its presence in India. The company aims to triple its revenue to over three billion euros by 2030. Safran will also quintuple its sourcing from India. New facilities in Hyderabad for engine maintenance and repair are being established. These investments underscore India's growing importance in Safran's global strategy.

items.title: Flexi-cap funds take the spotlight as small- and mid-caps falter
items.summary: With valuations high and earnings momentum cooling, investors are flocking to flexi-cap mutual funds that can pivot across market caps.

items.title: India’s crude oil imports from Russia in November 2025 hit a monthly record
items.summary: India’s import of Russian grade in November 2025 is expected to be at a 5-month high, driven by increased buying before November 21, the date by which the US sanctions against Rosneft and Lukoil come into effect

items.title: Amber Pepper to take over as CEO of Natural Diamond Council from Feb 1, 2026
items.summary: Her appointment follows the announcement that current CEO David Kellie will retire at the end of this year

items.title: COP30 event spotlight natural rubber as key climate solution
items.summary: It described natural rubber not only as a critical raw material but also as a strategic climate solution with its potential to contribute meaningfully to global mitigation efforts and net-zero targets

items.title: Canara, ICICI Bank gear up for Rs 7,500 crore bond issue this week
items.summary: Canara and ICICI Bank are set to raise a combined Rs 7,500 crore through AT1 and Tier-2 bonds this week. ICICI targets Rs 4,000 crore, while Canara plans Rs 3,500 crore, aiming to maintain strong capital adequacy and bolster long-term financial stability.

items.title: Vikram Solar commissions 5-GW solar module manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu
items.summary: Vikram Solar has commissioned a new 5 GW solar module manufacturing facility in Vallam, Tamil Nadu. This advanced plant boosts the company's total annual production capacity to 9.5 GW. The facility uses cutting-edge TOPCon technology and automation.

items.title: Nigeria's Dangote taps India’s EIL to double refining capacity to 1.4 million bpd
items.summary: Nigeria's Dangote has contracted Engineers India Ltd to double its refining capacity to 1.4 million barrels per day within three years. The company also plans to expand urea production to 12 million tons annually and will temporarily shut its RFCC for maintenance. These expansions aim to significantly boost Dangote's petrochemical output.

items.title: Diageo India's United Spirits cuts 93% green house gas emissions, exceeds renewable energy targets
items.summary: Diageo India has achieved a remarkable 93 percent cut in greenhouse gas emissions since 2020. The company now uses 99 percent renewable energy, surpassing its 2030 goals. Water conservation efforts have also seen significant improvements. Diageo India is leading in sustainable business practices, demonstrating strong environmental and social commitment.

items.title: Paisalo Digital share price extends gains to 2nd straight session after promoter group raises stake
items.summary: Paisalo Digital's stock rises 3% following a significant increase in stake by promoters. With strategic unpledging and upcoming NCD issuance, investors are closely watching this NBFC as it attempts a comeback in the market.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty jump 1% on global optimism, banks and metals lead broad market rally
items.summary: JSW Steel, Adani Ports, Bajaj twin shares lead gainers of Nifty 50, Bharti Airtel declines. Reliance, MCX, Axis Bank and SBI hit 52-week highs

items.title: SBI share price hits new all-time high, now on brink of crossing  ₹1,000 mark for first time
items.summary: State Bank of India (SBI) shares rose 1.6% to a record high of  ₹999, nearing the  ₹1,000 mark. SBI's market capitalisation reached  ₹9.20 lakh crore, making it the sixth most-valuable company in India, driven by improved credit demand and positive Q2 performance.

items.title: Toyota Bharat opens regional parts centre at TVS ILP park in Andhra Pradesh
items.summary: By establishing this facility with TVS ILP, TBIS aims to strengthen parts availability and accelerate service timelines, ensuring a more reliable customer experience across Andhra Pradesh and West Bengal

items.title: Faulty climate targets: Net-zero pledges won’t halt global warming but breakthrough innovations might
items.summary: The UN's COP30 ended with grand rhetoric but no meaningful climate gains, exposing a deep rift between rich-world ambitions and the development priorities of emerging economies. As today’s net-zero efforts seem unable to bend the emission curve, the world should bet on new technologies instead.

items.title: Natco Pharma shares jump over 5% after three-day slump
items.summary: Natco Pharma shares surged on Wednesday, bouncing back from a three-day decline that followed a US FDA inspection of its API manufacturing facility in Manali, Chennai, conducted from November 17–21, 2025. The inspection flagged seven Form-483 observations, which the company termed procedural and manageable.

items.summary: Accel, Info Edge, and Riverwalk Holdings participate in funding round

items.title: EMS sector still a ‘Sunrise Industry’ but valuations stretched: Dipan Mehta
items.summary: India's primary market is attracting significant retail investment, with some IPOs seeing massive subscriptions. While venture-funded companies are listing at high valuations, potentially disappointing investors, reasonably priced IPOs still emerge.  The quick commerce sector shows high potential but requires conviction, and innovative retailers like Unicommerce are noteworthy, alongside strong performers in the jewellery segment.

items.title: Reliance Power, Reliance Infrastructure shares rally up to 5% amid high trading volumes
items.summary: Reliance Power and Reliance Infrastructure saw strong intraday gains despite both stocks trading well below their yearly highs. Volumes softened against recent averages, yet sentiment improved following Reliance Power’s governance overhaul and clean-energy initiatives. The new Board of Management aims to strengthen oversight and support long-term value creation across the group.

items.summary: This approval marks the re-entry of the acid-reducing medication into the US market after a five-year absence

items.summary: Grain storage is needed to support the Public Distribution System and maintain price stability of food.

items.summary: Excelsoft Technologies shares rose sharply after a strong D-Street debut on Wednesday. The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 142.65 on the BSE, after debuting at Rs 135 against an IPO price of Rs 120. With FY25 PAT up 172% and strong SaaS growth, analysts say that investors may book partial profits while holding for medium-term gains amid client concentration and valuation risks.

items.title: Promoter exits and FII selling keeping markets in caution mode: Dipan Mehta
items.summary: The Indian equity market remains cautious, with the Nifty 50 facing resistance. Dipan Mehta sees potential for a significant rally or correction, emphasizing strong optimism for midcap stocks offering alpha. He expresses caution on IT services' long-term prospects despite potential trading rallies, while suggesting a steady approach to defense stocks.

items.summary: With this expansion, the Kolkata-based company now commands a total manufacturing capacity of 9.5 GW

items.title: Industrial Power Tariff Reform: Will it spark a new profit cycle?
items.summary: The Draft Electricity (Amendment) Bill, 2025, aims to eliminate cross-subsidies, allow private distribution, and align tariffs with actual costs. By reducing electricity expenses for industries, the reforms could boost profits and margins, especially for energy-intensive sectors like steel, cement, aluminium, and data centres. States with distorted tariffs stand to gain the most from this structural shift.

items.title: Gold, silver futures climb on Fed rate cut expectations after weak US data
items.summary: Markets participants now see more than an 80 per cent probability of a 25 basis points interest rate cut in December, up from about 50 per cent a week earlier

items.summary: Delhi’s Khan Market has retained its position among the world’s costliest retail locations, ranking 24th globally in Cushman & Wakefield’s Main Streets Across the World report. With rents rising 3% to USD 223 psf/yr, it remains India’s priciest high street amid strong demand and brand interest.

items.summary: The investment will help the company expand its manufacturing capabilities and power the launch of its 3C division (Charging, Care & Conversions)

items.summary: BSE Sensex climbed 307.93 points to 84,894.94 in early trade

items.title: Mint’s emerging markets tracker: Export slump, muted markets keep India at third spot in October
items.summary: Muted stock market gains and a deep export slump weighed heavily on India’s score in Mint's Emerging Market Tracker, countering its robust growth momentum. The country held on to the third position for the second consecutive month.

items.title: Why stock market rose today? 7 factors behind Sensex's 1,022-point rally, Nifty above 26,200
items.summary: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty surged on Wednesday, nearing record highs amid increased expectations of a US Fed rate cut. This rally was supported by global market gains, declining crude oil prices, and renewed FII buying. Analysts anticipate a durable tailwind for equities due to easing headwinds and a positive economic outlook.

items.summary: The investment would help to expand our manufacturing capabilities and power the launch of its 3C division (charging, care and conversions), says the company

items.summary: As Black Friday nears, Amazon alerts shoppers to cybercrime threats. Hackers exploit shoppers through impersonation tactics. Here's how the customers can keep their accounts and payment methods safe.&nbsp;

items.title: India's Rs 6.5 lakh crore wedding splurge: 10 stocks that could benefit with up to 38% upside
items.summary: India's wedding season is driving a massive Rs 6.5 lakh crore spending spree, creating a significant consumption wave. This boom is expected to benefit various sectors, with 10 stocks in fashion, jewellery, hospitality, and home goods poised for growth, some with potential upsides of up to 38%.

items.title: Indian bonds hold firm on rate-cut hopes
items.summary: Indian government bonds held steady Wednesday, with the benchmark 10-year yield hovering below 6.50% amid strong expectations of a rate cut next week. Recent low inflation and anticipated GDP growth are fueling optimism. Traders anticipate further gains if the yield remains below this crucial level, supported by positive sentiment from U.S. Treasury movements.

items.title: NDL Ventures board approves merger of Hinduja Leyland Finance into NDL Ventures
items.summary: NDL Ventures’ board has approved the merger of Hinduja Leyland Finance into the company, paving the way for a significant consolidation within the Hinduja Group. Under the Scheme of Merger, HLFL will be absorbed into NDL Ventures, with shareholders receiving 25 shares for every 10 held. The proposal now awaits regulatory and NCLT approvals.

items.title: Tata Motors Passenger Vehicles shares rise 3% on reintroducing Sierra SUV under Rs 15 lakh
items.summary: Tata Motors' stock surged following the unveiling of the 2025 Sierra SUV, a revival of the iconic 1990s model. Priced competitively starting at Rs 11.49 lakh, it targets the mid-size SUV segment. Bookings open December 16, 2025, with deliveries in January 2026, offering multiple powertrain and variant options, including a future AWD version.

items.title: Adani Enterprises shares get buy call from Ventura; 43% upside expected as fundraise eases balance sheet pressure
items.summary: Ventura Securities has initiated a bullish call on Adani Enterprises with a Buy rating and a SOTP-based target price of ₹3,433 — implying 43% upside. The brokerage believes the company’s ₹25,000 crore fundraise is well-timed to support its capital-intensive growth areas such as airports, green hydrogen, and copper, reinforcing AEL’s role as the Adani Group’s incubator for future businesses.

items.title: Rate cut speculation and Fed Chair rumors keeping markets on edge: Ed Yardeni
items.summary: Markets anticipate a December interest rate cut by the Federal Reserve. This shift follows dovish signals from Fed officials. Investors also await the announcement of the next Fed chair. Economic data allows for varied interpretations, but suggests conditions for a rate cut. The technology sector shows increased stock selectivity, with Google currently favored over Nvidia amid competitive AI advancements.

items.title: Gold price jumps Rs 1,800 amid volatility this week. Is the rally just getting started?
items.summary: Gold and silver extended their gains on Wednesday, with gold rising nearly Rs 1,800 and silver jumping over Rs 3,800 so far this week amid global volatility. Hopes of a December US Fed rate cut and optimism around a potential Ukraine–Russia peace deal supported sentiment, while analysts expect continued choppiness with a broader upside bias.

items.summary: With this integration, Zoho CRM users can now capture verified addresses, visualise customer locations, discover potential leads in nearby areas, and optimise sales routes

items.title: NBFC borrowings to reach $750 billion by FY27: Study
items.summary: By FY27, market-based instruments are expected to make up 64% of total NBFC borrowings, compared to 43% in FY24, reflecting a gradual reduction in bank credit

items.title: India–US trade deal may unlock next market rally as midcaps, smallcaps stay under pressure: Ambareesh Baliga
items.summary: Independent market analyst Ambareesh Baliga says the upcoming India–US trade deal could be the key trigger to push markets beyond all-time highs and revive beaten-down midcaps and smallcaps. He remains bullish on autos—especially Maruti, Hero MotoCorp and TVS—and sees a realty rebound led by Navi Mumbai, favouring Godrej Properties and Arihant Superstructures as sales momentum strengthens.

Investors are scrutinizing the financial implications of a substantial stimulus package and the possibility of an imminent interest rate hike by the Bank of Japan.  Concerns linger over the market's capacity to absorb increased government debt amidst evolving economic signals.

items.title: Infosys’ Rs 18,000 crore share buyback: Last day for investors to tender shares. Here’s all you need to know
items.summary: Infosys buyback: November 26 marks the final opportunity for eligible shareholders to tender shares in Infosys' Rs 18,000 crore buyback program. Shareholders can tender shares at Rs 1,800 apiece, with acceptance ratios varying significantly for retail and general categories.

items.summary: Among top gainers on the Nifty50, JSW Steel surged 2.90 per cent to ₹1,144.30, Adani Ports jumped 2.19 per cent to ₹1,516.40, and Tata Motors (TMPV) gained 2.16 per cent to ₹360.05

Analysts see a positive trend despite recent profit-booking. The company's strong quarterly results and optimistic demand outlook, including potential for increased exports, support this positive sentiment.

items.title: Did HDFC AMC shares really tank 50%? Here's how the bonus math works

The price adjustment reflects the addition of new shares without impacting investor wealth. Shareholders on record as of November 25 will receive bonus shares in the company’s first-ever such issuance.

items.title: MCX shares cross Rs 10,000 for the first time. What’s fuelling the rally?

The exchange's recent performance shows robust growth in profit and trading turnover, particularly in the bullion segment. New product launches are also contributing to its positive trajectory.

Markets increasingly expect a December rate hike, supported by rising yields and stronger hawkish voices within the BOJ. Policy normalisation appears closer as economic pressures and government support align.

items.summary: Taking on Nvidia’s dominance would require Google to overcome nearly two decades of proprietary Nvidia code that has made the company’s ecosystem hard to dislodge

items.title: Stock Market Highlights 26th November 2025: Sensex jumps 1,022.50 points; Nifty inches near record high on US fed rate cut hopes
items.summary:
Snapping the three-day falling streak, benchmark Sensex rebounded by 1,022 points while Nifty reclaimed the 26,000 level on Wednesday on across-the-board buying aided by a rally in global peers amid growing hopes of a US Fed rate cut and fresh foreign fund inflows.

The 30-share BSE Sensex jumped 1,022.50 points or 1.21 per cent to settle at 85,609.51. During the day, it surged 1,057.18 points or 1.24 per cent to 85,644.19.

The 50-share NSE Nifty zoomed 320.50 points or 1.24 per cent to end at 26,205.30, just 10 points shy of its all time high.

In intra-day trade, Nifty rallied 330.35 points
